info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 10:16PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...GUSTY NORTHERLY WINDS CONTINUE BEHIND STRONG COLD FRONT... At 10:00 PM, surface observations across Deep South Texas continued to show strong wind gusts behind a cold front that pushed through earlier this evening. Wind gusts are particularly strongest along and east of US-281/I-69C with frequent gusts between 35 and 45 mph (occasionally higher) occurring since the frontal passage. These winds are expected to gradually subside before midnight tonight, but a Wind Advisory may need to be issued for Hidalgo and Brooks counties if these wind gusts persist over the next hour or two. Secure any outdoor decorations or objects that may get tossed around by the wind, and high profile vehicles should be driven with caution, especially on east-to-west oriented roads.
